title.rendered: Mumbai vs Delhi, Final, India Women’s League 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team on basis of probable XIs, recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Mumbai: Hayley Matthews, Yastika Bhatia (wk), Nat Sciver-Brunt, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Amelia Kerr, Pooja Vastrakar, Issy Wong, Amanjot Kaur, Humaira Kazi, Jintimani Kalita, Saika Ishaque

Delhi: Meg Lanning (c), Shafali Verma, Alice Capsey, Jemimah Rodrigues, Marizanne Kapp, Taniya Bhatia (wk), Jess Jonassen, Radha Yadav, Arundhati Reddy, Shikha Pandey, Poonam Yadav

Pitch Report

Venue: Brabourne Stadium, Mumbai

(Based on last three matches)

1st innings average score: 168

2nd innings average score: 195

Wickets per innings: 5

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: —

Batting 2nd: 100%

Fantasy Tips of The Day 

Issy Wong has been sensational in the tournament, excelling in all three departments. In addition to picking 12 wickets and contributing with the bat down the order, she has grabbed six catches – the joint most in the tournament.

Meg Lanning, the top run-getter (310 at 52) in the tournament, has been unbeatable at the Brabourne Stadium: she has scored 304 runs at an average of 101, without being dismissed in four of seven matches.

Hayley Matthews and Nat Sciver-Brunt have been the most selected players for a reason: between them, they have scalped 23 wickets at 15 and scored 530 runs at 41.

Saika Ishaque has picked 15 wickets at a strike rate of 12 in this tournament. In addition, she has twice generated bonus points for a maiden over and four times for an economy rate.

Shafali Verma has given 55 points just by smashing fours and sixes, in addition to generating 20 points for a strike rate – all this while scoring 241 runs at 34.

Marizanne Kapp and Alice Capsey were the captain and vice-captain of the Best11 when Delhi thumped Mumbai by nine wickets in their last encounter. They have the Best11 percentage of 100 in the previous five matches.

Number four and five batters combined to score five fifties and three thirties in the last three matches at the venue. During this period, spinners grabbed 63% of wickets.
